info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 3:28PM EDT until July 12 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...The following county, in central Ohio, Franklin.
* WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 328 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Columbus, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Grove City, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Worthington, Bexley, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Ohio State University, Easton, Whitehall, New Albany, Grandview Heights, Obetz, Urbancrest and Valleyview.
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
